entry.title: Introducing the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap
entry.content:
There is no better way to start the year and set the tone for 2026 than with exciting news: we are happy to announce the release of the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap.

Over the past months, we have been focusing on how to best support customers who have acquired SAP Business Network for Logistics in implementing the solution successfully, efficiently, and with confidence. The result is a carefully designed roadmap that guides implementation teams without overwhelming them with unnecessary complexity.

Our goal was clear: create a roadmap that covers the full scope of the solution, including its three core products — Freight Collaboration, Global Track and Trace, and Intelligent Insights — while remaining intuitive, practical, and easy to navigate.

Why SAP Business Network for Logistics?

The SAP Business Network for Logistics solution offers an opportunity to establish a better collaboration with shippers and carriers to optimize end-to-end logistics processes, improve operations, get real-time insights into logistics execution, increase on-time deliveries and mitigate supply risk.

With the new SAP Activate roadmap, customers now have a structured, best-practice-driven approach to turn these capabilities into tangible business value.

What to Expect from the SAP Activate Roadmap?

The roadmap follows the familiar SAP Activate phases and provides clear guidance at every step of the implementation journey, as illustrated below:

Throughout all phases, the roadmap is designed to be easy to navigate and adapt to your specific project needs. Using the Road Map Viewer, you can filter tasks and deliverables by Workstreams, Products, Tags, or Roles to quickly focus on what matters most for your implementation. When a SAP Business Network for Logistics product requires specific procedures or essential accelerators, the related tasks are clearly identified under the “Product” category. For example, as you can see below, within "SBN for Logistics for Freight Collaboration" filter, you will find dedicated tasks covering initial access, self-enablement, Fit-to-Standard workshops, integration, and configuration.

To support execution beyond planning, the roadmap is also available in SAP Cloud ALM, where it can be selected as a project template as illustrated in the following image. This enables teams to track progress, assign tasks to responsible stakeholders, manage timelines, mark tasks as Not Relevant when applicable, and monitor the implementation end to end.

We encourage you to explore the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap and share your feedback, either through this blog post or directly via the Road Map Viewer. Your input helps us continuously refine our roadmaps and ensure they remain relevant and valuable throughout your implementation journey.

entry.title: Re: Fixed activity XXXXXXXXXX | 010 | P
entry.content:
Found the root cause of this issue on further analysis.

Root Cause: The Production order start date of the particular operation was in past which was beyond the past limit of the time profile used

Step by step analysis:

Issue: Planning Job failed for Scheduling check in SM37 t-code

Planning Engine: PPDS Optimizer

Log Check: Checked the log with exact date and time in t-code /SAPAPO/RRPLOG1 

There is not much information in SM37 but you will find the details in /SAPAPO/RRPLOG1 where the detail information was given. In this log, there was scheduling tab as well, there the Production Number will be there

Check that Production order number and its specific operation number or activity start date in CO03 in ECC or S/4 (whichever you use), it will be outside of the time profile used, meaning suppose the time profile is set as 6 months in past and 12 in future but particular operation of your's start date Production Order is outside of 6 months, in this case system cannot schedule/re-schedule this operation and hence job will fail.

Solution: There are several solutions you can adopt depending on client or your projet.

1. Exclude that Production Order from the re-scheduling step of the job

2. Change the start date of the operation which is outside of the time profile, bring it inside the range of your time profile 

3. Confirm that operation in ECC or S/4 

My Recommendation: Go for option 01 as there is no impact on planning if you exclude the production order from re-scheduling step of your job

Approach: In this error, try to find out the production order which is causing this issue, then find out the activity responsible for this issue, this will be in log, operation may be called as activity in log., this will help you to resolve the error

Hope this is helpful to you all whoso ever is reading this

 

Best Regards

entry.title: Re: Error when extending Standard CDS view with UNION ALL
entry.content:
Dear @Praveen_Kumar40266,

In Public Cloud you won’t be able to extend P_ObjPgMaintOrderAndOperation the way you tried for two reasons that both block extensions:

  1. It’s a P_... projection view meant to serve a specific Fiori Object Page. CDS view entity extensions can’t append fields to CDS projection views
  2. Extending a CDS view entity with set operators is only possible if SAP modeled the view with the proper enhancement category needs #UNION in the view enhancement category. If SAP didn’t you’ll get exactly the contains union extends are not allowed type of error and you can’t change that in Public Cloud

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_latest_index_htm/latest/en-US/ABENCDS_EXTEND_VIEW_ENTITY.html

So the practical options in Public Cloud are:

Option 1.

If your goal is show/maintain additional fields in the standard Maintenance Order / Operation apps, this is the supported path:

  • Use the Custom Fields app to create fields in the right business context: Maintenance Order / Operation
  • Publish the field and enable it for UI usage and OData/reporting if needed
  • Then add it to the UI via the app extensibility capabilities for the relevant maintenance apps

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/3ccb50e724b045508fea8b2cf1774b2b.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/57909455bf7c4fdd8bcf48d76c1eae33.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/55a7cb346519450cb9e6d21c1ecd6ec1/20a91308a4304cc297e2f2e36198c616.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-service/build-service-guide/using-extensibility-wizard

IMPORTANT:

In Public Cloud you normally do not bring AUFK-ZZ fields into a standard view instead you create YY1_... custom fields in the business context and let SAP propagate them

Option 2.

If you need extra fields for extraction/reporting/integration not necessarily inside the standard object page data source:

  • Create a Custom CDS View based on released VDM views for Maintenance Orders/Operations instead of using the P_... object page projection view as your base
  • Expose it as OData or use it in Custom Analytical Queries app

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/8573b810511948c8a99c0672abc159aa.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/e30de6eae4d24d70b65996ac8ff88848.html

This is often the cleanest approach when the standard projection view is closed for extension

Option 3.

If you must combine extra data that you can’t get into the standard apps data source build a side-by-side app/service on BTP and consume the released APIs. This aligns with the Public Cloud extensibility model

More details below:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-developer-extensibility-sap-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13570390

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/7139c1648de84c0bbd7637589ed7c92a.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/2a17a3e1525f4f46a9c5156bd2d3bc87.html

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP FOR DUMMIES #1 - ¿Qué es y por qué se convirtió en el "as bajo la manga" profesional?
entry.content:
¡Hola! Soy @MatiasLemos, Consultor SAP apasionado por la tecnología, automatización e inteligencia artificial.

¡Bienvenido a esta nueva seccion llamada SAP for Dummies!

El objetivo es contarte todo el camino desde 0 hasta que puedas volverte Consultor SAP en Argentina o que puedas trabajar correctamente con SAP en cualquiera de sus productos.

Si pasaste más de cinco minutos navegando en LinkedIn o revisando portales de empleo, es casi seguro que te cruzaste con estas tres letras: SAP (Systemanalyse Programmentwicklung) o mas facil "Sistemas, Aplicaciones y Productos".

A menudo se lo percibe como un sistema complejo y algo distante, reservado solo para ingenieros o especialistas en IT. Sin embargo, en el ecosistema empresarial actual —desde las grandes multinacionales hasta las empresas locales con proyección—, SAP es el idioma en el que se habla de eficiencia. Pero, ¿de qué se trata realmente y por qué hoy parece ser el centro de todas las conversaciones de carrera?

El cerebro detrás de las organizaciones que funcionan

Para explicarlo de forma sencilla: imaginate una empresa como una gran orquesta. Tenés a la gente de finanzas, compras, ventas, recursos humanos y logística. Si cada área toca su propia partitura sin mirar al resto, el resultado es puro ruido.

SAP es el director de esa orquesta. Es un sistema de gestión (ERP) que permite que todas las áreas de una compañía compartan la misma información en tiempo real. Si un vendedor en Buenos Aires cierra un trato, el depósito en Córdoba ya sabe que tiene que preparar el envío y el área contable ya tiene la factura lista para procesar. Todo fluye, sin "teléfonos descompuestos" ni archivos de Excel que no coinciden entre departamentos.

El dato: No es casualidad que las empresas más importantes del país y del mundo lo elijan. SAP aporta la estructura y la trazabilidad que un negocio necesita para escalar de manera profesional.

¿Por qué hay tanto ruido alrededor de SAP en este 2026?

No es una moda pasajera; estamos atravesando un momento de transformación estructural por dos razones clave:

  1. La evolución tecnológica: Miles de compañías están migrando sus sistemas a la nube (específicamente a SAP S/4HANA). Este recambio genera una demanda de talento sin precedentes para liderar esos procesos de cambio.

  2. Un pasaporte global: El perfil profesional argentino es muy valorado afuera por su capacidad de análisis. Saber SAP permite trabajar en proyectos globales desde cualquier rincón del país, con una proyección de carrera y una competitividad salarial que pocos sectores ofrecen hoy.

Una oportunidad de "reinvención" para todos

Acá es donde se pone interesante para quienes buscan un nuevo rumbo. Existe el mito de que para trabajar en el mundo SAP hay que ser un experto en programación. Nada más alejado de la realidad.

  • Para el estudiante: Salir al mercado laboral con conocimientos de SAP es, literalmente, saltarse varios casilleros. Te da un perfil ejecutivo y una ventaja competitiva desde el primer día.

  • Para el profesional que busca un cambio: Podés capitalizar toda tu experiencia previa. Un contador puede especializarse en el módulo de Finanzas (FI); alguien que viene de procesos industriales, en Producción (PP) o Materiales (MM). No estás empezando de cero, estás dándole un "upgrade" premium a tu trayectoria.

En conclusión

Involucrarse en el ecosistema SAP no es solo aprender a usar un software; es entender la lógica de los negocios modernos. En un mercado tan competitivo como el nuestro, donde a veces parece que "remamos en dulce de leche", contar con formación en SAP es, posiblemente, la inversión con mayor retorno que podés hacer en tu futuro.

No hace falta ser un experto en sistemas para empezar. Solo hace falta curiosidad para entender cómo se mueve el motor de las empresas hoy en día.

Si te quedo alguna duda o consulta por favor dejala acá abajo para poder ayudarte o contactame via Linkedin!

https://www.linkedin.com/in/matiassap/

Muchas gracias por leer y ser parte de la familia SAP Community Argentina.

entry.title: How to Create a CAP Hello World Application to test
entry.content:
Getting started with SAP CAP.

The easiest way to create an SAP CAP application is to develop it in the SAP 
Business Application Studio in the SAP Cloud. As all the needed Extensions 
are already preinstalled.

1- Login to your SAP Business Application Studio.
Create a Dev Spaces Full Stack Cloud Application you can call the Dev space anything you would like.

2- After creating and the Dev Space is running click on it to continue.
     We are now in our workspace.
3- Next, Click on New Project from Templet.

4- Next scroll down until you see the CAP Project.
5- Select the CAP Project.
6- Click Start >

7- Enter your project name: helloworld.
8- Select your runtime: Nodejs.

9- Click on Finish.

We now have our starting point to develop our SAP CAP Application.

In the next step we need to add some dependencies.
If we check the package.Json file, we can see that there are two dependencies that are needed
to ensure we have the updated version we will need to run the npm install.

10- From the terminal windows run 
11- npm install

We can see the npm install was successful.
Next from the same terminal window run.
12- npm add -g @SAP/cds-dk

We can see the @SAP/cds-dk install was successful.
This will ensure that we have the latest versions installed and this will avoid any issues.
Next
13- Right click on the folder srv.

14- Select New File.

15- Name the file hello-service.cds

Once the hello-service.cds file is created we can see an empty file we will need to add some code
16- Add the following code snippet to hello-service.cds

service HelloService {

 function sayHello(name : String) returns String;
}

17- Next, we now need to add another file called hello-service.js
18- Right click on the SRV folder again.

19- Select from the menu New File.

20- call the file hello-service.js
21- Save the file hello-service.js
22- Next will need to add the following code snippet to our hello-service.js

const cds = require('@sap/cds');
class HelloService extends cds.ApplicationService {
sayHello(name) { return "Hello " + name; }
}

module.exports = HelloService;

23- Save the file.

If we start the project to test and see where we are and to check the coding
from the Terminal windows we can run the following command
24- cds watch

when we run cds watch the startup will have the destination HTTP address
on the local host and will be listening on Port 4004. in our web browser we can simply add the URL http://localhost:4004 to check our page. 

We will only see the following.

The name is a parameter holder there for we need to pass in a value to the say hello.

 The reason is we are setting up an ODATA V4 call that will send a GET request via the HTTP test page. in the next step we will walk thru on how to send the request.

Next, we will create a test folder and then create a test http test file to pass in the variable
for name.

Note: Do not name the test http using html otherwise this will not work.

25- Right click on our project and create new folder.

26- Call the folder test. 
Now we need to create a test http file. This is needed for sending the data value to the service.

27- Right click on the test folder and select create new file.
28- call the file test.http.

We now need to add the following code snippet to the test.http.

@baseUrl = http://localhost:4004/odata/v4
GET {{baseUrl}}/hello/sayHello(name='this my first World applicaion')

This is our test.http when we test this page it will send the GET request to the server
Http://localhost on the port 4004 and the format will be ODATA V4 and the character set
will be UTF-8.
If you noticed on the test.http page there is now Send Request that was created when we saved the page.

Important for future references to test ODATA we can simply create a test http page
in a test folder and simply add our URI to the page in this way we can send the ODATA request.
This is very helpful when testing the result sets and to ensure they are working correctly. 
As we declared base URl = http://localhost:4004/odata/v4 on the next line we then make a call GET
Notice the baseURL this is pointing to the declaration we made on the first line this is pointing to our URL localhost:4004

Also note we added the get request {{baseUrl}}/hello/sayHello(name='this my first World application'). Now the GET {{baseUrl}}/hello/sayHello(name='this my first World application').
In turn the Get request will use base URL and send the statement name=( 'this my first World application'). Once understood it is a very simple example. Note the format request in the URL is ODATA/V4.

We can add whatever Name we want to send to the URL statement under the statement name =
Now we have everything in place it is now time to test and see if everything will work.
Next 

29- Go back to the Terminal.
30- Run the following command cds watch 
       if the cds watch is already running stop it and start it again

Watch the terminal windows as it will report any error in the cds file or js file.
When testing it is helpful to keep an eye on the terminal window for messages. 

We can now see the server is up and running and there are no errors. 
Next open a web browser and add the URL to our page or simple click on Open in a New tab
this will open the web browser for us.

Next 
Now that our server is up and running let’s test it.

31- Go to the test.http file under the test directory. 

32- Click on the Send Request.
After clicking on the Send Request a popup box will show our request.

In the Terminal window we also see the ODATA call that was sent to the http://localhost:4004/ODATA/V4.

This is a good starting point at any time when creating CAP applications we can create a test.http page and then create multiple ODATA
call to test. As an example, in the CAP Books there are defined test.http calls
Examples.

GET {{bookshop}}/odata/v4/orders/Orders
### Create order, still inactive
POST {{bookshop}}/odata/v4/orders/Orders
Content-Type: application/json
{"ID": "{{newOrderID}}"}
### Get inactive order. We must specify `IsActiveEntity`.
GET {{bookshop}}/odata/v4/orders/Orders(ID={{newOrderID}},IsActiveEntity=false)

As we can see in the above examples the URL declaration for the URL is bookshop
then on the GET request are calling the bookshop and sending in the request.
In testing this is great and can help in testing different ODATA calls.
Also note the declaration for the ODATA V4.

This is a very simple project that can start anyone on their journey. Designing by example is the best way of learning SAP also provides many examples on SAP CAP and SAP BAS to help elevate your skill sets.

entry.title: Reporting the latest effective date of Job Information field leveraging EC Configuration
entry.content:
Introduction

Customers frequently request reports that show the most recent data point of a certain field in Job information. The Job information object is effective dated, and the effective date is not necessarily tied to a particular field when a new event record is created.

The report administrator can create manual change report logic built into the report (Link). However, that logic pulls only the employees with changes and excludes employees whose record haven’t changed within the selected date range or since the hire event.  

Customers can leverage Employee Central (EC) configuration to support reporting data points. If a new customer is implementing EC, the latest effective date fields should be considered as requirements during EC implementation. For existing customers, this blog can be shared with the system administrator to create a new custom field if the custom fields limit hasn't been reached.

Solution

Steps are shown below. 

  1. Create a custom date field in Manage Business Configuration, in Jobinfo (or wherever it applies). Please note this is an example; you can create the custom fields for other business needs, such as Job code change date. In this case, we’re creating the latest Job title effective date so create a date field in Jobinfo. We label it ‘Test Change date’ to identify the  latest Job title effective date.

2. Add permission for the custom field. 

3. Create a business rule (Configure Business Rule)

Trigger OnChange of Job title rules for HRIS Elements

4. Go back to Manage Business Configuration > Jobinfo > Find the field (Job Title) > Detail > and add the rule in Trigger Rule section.

 

5. Once the change record is entered, (in this case, the change of ‘Job title’), the custom field, ‘Test Change date’ will be updated.

6. Create a Story report. In the Job Information table, 'Test Change date' is visible. 

7. Consider applying a hiring rule for the newly hired employees in the future, to set their custom field date to be hire date, following rule is needed. (Otherwise, the ‘Test Change date’ field will be null until a Job title change occurs.)

Add this rule to ‘OnSave’ of EmploymentInfo in BCUI > Trigger Rules.

 

Conclusion

In sum, Reporting can provide data from the system and bridge the information through reporting functions and logic. However, depending on the business requirements, reporting may require data points that must be supported by configuration. The blog shows one example of incorporating Employee Central configuration to complement reporting.

Please feel free to leave a comment below. Special thanks to @sufiya.nadaf@sap.com for a thorough explanation of the EC configuration parts.

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Performance Monitoring and Analysis Tools
entry.content:
SAP Analytics Cloud Monitoring – Why It Matters More Than Ever 

In today’s data-driven enterprises, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) has become the central hub for planning, reporting, and decision-making. As organizations scale their analytics footprint, it becomes increasingly clear that performance determines adoption. SAC performance is influenced by more than just what happens inside the tool. Network latency, browser limitations, backend systems like BW, HANA, or S/4HANA, and even user behavior can all affect the experience. This makes proactive monitoring not just helpful—but essential. SAC provides a rich set of monitoring and analysis tools such as the Performance Analysis Tool, Performance Statistics & Analysis, Query Analysis, Data Action Monitoring, and Data Management Jobs Monitoring. This blog explores how SAC monitoring works, some of the tools that are available and how to interpret the data surfaced by these tools so that your tenant is fast, stable, and ready for the business.

Understanding What Influences Performance in SAC

Monitoring SAC effectively begins with understanding how SAC functions at runtime. Every interaction in SAC — whether loading a story, running a Data Action, importing data, or refreshing a widget — is influenced by three primary layers:

  1. Frontend (Client Device + Browser): The user’s browser handles story rendering, widget layout, graphics, and scripting. The device’s CPU, RAM, browser version, and even background applications influence perceived performance.
  2. Network Path: SAC is a cloud application so network latency, VPNs, firewalls, and bandwidth impact how quickly data is transmitted between the browser and the SAC.
  3. Backend System: Depending on the connection type: HANA, BW, or S/4HANA handle query execution for live data, SAC’s embedded HANA Cloud layer handles calculations for acquired data and Planning actions use SAC’s in-memory planning engine. Monitoring these layers helps administrators understand where a slowdown originates and whether it is client-side, network-related, or backend-driven. 

Monitoring Tools Inside SAP Analytics Cloud : SAP Analytics Cloud consolidates its monitoring tools mostly under the Performance section.

Performance Measurement Tool: When you run the Client Test, it evaluates whether the user’s device and browser can run SAC workloads efficiently. The Measurement Tool benchmarks the user’s environment, measuring Client Score (browser and CPU performance), Bandwidth, Network Latency and Overall Network Score. This helps determine whether slowness is specific to a single user, VPN/proxy routing or Bandwidth limitations. This tool is critical in shared work environments where network and device variability affect user experience. Some key questions that the Performance Measurement Tool helps answer:

  • Is the user’s laptop/browser causing SAC to slow?
  • Is CPU/RAM on the user’s device overloaded?
  • Is high latency affecting story performance?
  • Is bandwidth too low for large datasets?
  • Is the VPN causing delay?

Performance Analysis Tool: The Performance Analysis Tool provides a session-level diagnostic view of how long a story or analytic application takes to load in SAP Analytics Cloud. It breaks total runtime into frontend (browser rendering), network (data transfer), and backend (data source processing) time, enabling precise root-cause analysis of performance issues. The tool helps analyze story initialization, page navigation, widget rendering, and backend query execution, making it especially valuable during high-visibility reporting cycles where user experience must be closely monitored. By clearly identifying which layer and which component is causing delays, the Performance Analysis Tool answers critical questions such as:

  • Why a story or page is slow?
  • Whether the issue is browser-, network-, or backend-related?
  • Which widget or query is the bottleneck?
  • Whether performance issues are user-specific or system-wide?
  • Whether recent changes caused performance degradation? In summary, the Performance Analysis Tool helps teams quickly understand where SAC is spending time, what is slowing the experience, and where optimization efforts should be focused.

Performance Statistics & Analysis: Performance Statistics & Analysis provides a tenant-wide, historical view of system performance and usage in SAP Analytics Cloud. Unlike session-level tools, it allows administrators to analyze performance trends at scale across stories, models, queries, connections, users, and time periods. The tool captures aggregated performance metrics, including query runtimes, data volumes, request frequency, and elapsed execution time, enabling proactive identification of system hotspots and recurring performance patterns. Key questions that performance Statistics and Analysis helps answer:

  • Which stories, pages, or widgets have the longest runtimes?
  • Which queries repeatedly exceed performance thresholds?
  • Which models generate the highest request volumes or backend load?
  • Which users or teams contribute most to system demand?
  • Which data sources and connection types are most heavily used?
  • When peak usage periods occur and how they affect performance?
  • Which content is business-critical versus rarely used? In summary, the Performance Statistics & Analysis enables proactive performance management, helping administrators answer not just “what is slow?” but “why it is slow, who is impacted, and where optimization will deliver the greatest benefit.”

 Data Action Performance Statistics : Planning workloads require deeper monitoring. Data Action Performance Statistics provides step-by-step execution durations including Time spent in advanced formulas, memory consumption patterns, execution history, comparison across different runs This type of monitoring is essential during budgeting and forecasting cycles where planning procedures involve large data volumes and iterative processing. Planning Runtime Questions that this tool helps answer:

  • Why is a Data Action running slowly?
  • Which step of the data action script takes longest?
  • Are advanced formulas or FOREACH loops the root cause?
  • Did the Data Action get slower over time?

Data Management Job Monitoring: For acquired data, SAC relies on scheduled imports and data acquisition jobs. The Data Management Monitor shows: Job runtime, Job failures, Scheduling issues, Data volume imported, Source system connectivity status. It supports monitoring across SAP and non-SAP sources, ensuring that SAC content relying on acquired data remains up-to-date and consistent. Data Load Questions that this tool helps answer:

  • Why is a data import failing?
  • Why did a data load take longer today than last week?
  • Are source systems throttling or rejecting traffic?
  • Are specific connections (OData, S/4, BW) unstable?

Private Versions Statistics : Private versions allow planners to experiment independently without affecting public data. This tool tracks Private version creation time, Load time, Save time, Data footprint. Large or inefficient versions can impact planning performance across the tenant. Monitoring private versions helps manage storage and execution costs. Version Behavior Questions that this tool helps answer:                               

  • Are planners creating overly large private versions?
  • Which versions take longest to load/save/copy?
  • Are specific users overloading the system with huge versions?

Error Statistics & Analysis: This tool captures system-level errors such as Authentication issues, Model errors, Rendering failures, Data action exceptions, Backend connectivity errors,. It allows administrators to detect recurring operational issues and coordinate with backend or network teams based on error patterns. Diagnosis Questions would be:

  • What errors are happening most frequently?
  • Which users are impacted by failures?
  • Are errors caused by roles, data models, or expired credentials

Model Side Statistics and Analysis: The Model Size Statistics and Analysis tool provides a centralized overview of data consumption across models, versions, and data types. It helps administrators identify the largest models, understand what is driving data growth (such as transactional data or audit logs), and pinpoint which versions consume the most storage. Some of the questions that this tool helps answer:

  • Which models are the largest and contribute most to overall data storage?
  • How is data volume distributed across models, versions, and data types?
  • What is driving data growth—transactional data, master data, or audit logs?
  • Which versions within a model (such as Budget or Forecast) consume the most space?
  • Where should optimization or cleanup efforts be prioritized to control data growth

Monitoring Supports a Healthy SAC Landscape

Monitoring is not just about detecting problems — it is about understanding the behavior of SAC over time. Insights from SAC’s tools help with Capacity planning, Story and model optimization, Infrastructure tuning, Improving planning performance, Identifying patterns across user groups, Prioritizing backend improvements, Coordinating analytics and IT teams, Reducing user complaints and escalations. A well-monitored SAC environment becomes predictable, stable, and efficient — offering business users a smooth, reliable analytics and planning experience.

entry.title: Question about multiple global hierarchies
entry.content:
Hi Team,

The current implementation of two global hierarchies in the SAPUI5 Fiori app, bound to a tree table, requires four API calls per hierarchy. Scaling this to 12 hierarchies would necessitate 48 API calls, leading to significant performance degradation, data latency, and potential application crashes. Consequently, utilizing a custom ui5 Fiori app for retrieving multiple hierarchies is inefficient. Additionally, for every hierarchy in 4 th API call - need to aggregate the amount if id is unique. So multiple unique ids present applicable for all hierarchies, So achieving global hierarchy in SBS is not a good option with multiple api calls and data calculation in every 4 th api call and data wil be millions in production.

I suggested that the client, SBS fiori app is not a good option to achieve this requirement by calling APIS 48 times, every hierarchy we need to check repeated ids and calculate the total amount for unique id in the back end.

Also fiori app will use for limited data set. Not like million records calculations in the backend .

 

Question : - 

We are trying to build a GL Line Item report that has the functionality to display the report in "multiple global hierarchies" such as profit center, cost center and GL Account (total 12 multiple global hierarchies) in the same report. Side by side application has limitations, we want to know if there is a standard functionality to achieve this.

 

Thanks,

Madhava

entry.title: OCN OData API - "Error adding OCN course" for ALL providers including GO1 on partner demo tenant
entry.content:
## Environment

 

- Tenant: sfcpart002659 (Partner Demo)

- API Endpoint: /learning/odatav4/public/admin/ocn/v1/OcnCourses

 

## Issue

 

POST requests to create OCN courses fail with a generic error for ALL providers - both custom (DLA) and built-in (GO1):

 

{"error":{"code":null,"message":"Error adding OCN course - test-go1-001"}}

 

The operationStatusDetail=true parameter does not return additional details.

 

## What Works

 

- OAuth token generation via /learning/oauth-api/rest/v1/token

- GET requests to $metadata and OcnCourses

- Provider configuration visible in Content > Open Content Network

 

## What We Configured

 

1. Created provider "DLA" in OPEN_CONTENT_NETWORK system configuration

2. Created label label.u.DLA with proper locale value

3. Created admin user with OCN_ADMIN role (with "Open Content Network Import" permission)

4. DLA appears correctly as "Data Literacy Academy (DLA)" in Content Providers list

 

## Testing Performed

 

| Provider | Payload | Result |

|----------|---------|--------|

| DLA | Full payload with launchType 4 | Error adding OCN course |

| DLA | Minimal payload | Error adding OCN course |

| GO1 | Minimal payload | Error adding OCN course |

 

## Questions

 

1. Is there additional tenant-level configuration required to enable OCN course imports via OData API?

2. Are partner demo tenants restricted from using the OCN POST API?

3. What could cause this error for built-in providers like GO1?

entry.title: Re: Print Supplier Invoice
entry.content:
Dear @Satish110,

Below is the standard setup that makes the tile actually produce a PDF and send it to a local printer

Point 1.

The cloud help text indicates the app can trigger the output report and can be scheduled

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/6583f0d4d799462f929b5ba0832211c7.html

Point 2.

2.1 Create the Communication Arrangement for printing

For pull-printing with local printers, SAP uses communication scenarios SAP_COM_0466 / SAP_COM_0467

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/1e39bb68bbda4c48af4a79d35f5837e0.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/ed3e22de359d4955a51c9164da1315ff.html

In Public Cloud:

  1. Open Maintain Communication Users, create a technical user for printing
  2. Open Communication Systems, create a system entry your print runtime
  3. Open Communication Arrangements + New + choose scenario SAP_COM_0466 and assign:
    • the Communication System
    • the Communication User

2.2 Create a Print Queue in Public Cloud

  1. Open Maintain Print Queues

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F1260')/S35

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2925982

  1. Create a new queue typically PDF format
  2. Ensure the queue is assigned/usable for the communication setup SAP_COM_0466

2.3 Install and configure SAP Cloud Print Manager

IMPORTANT:

In Google put sentense: SAP CLOUD PRINT MANAGER FOR PULL INTEGRATION QUICK GUIDE and you will find below PDF file for more details

 

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/964486f5b55347bea772211a02838b71.html

Point 3.

In Public Cloud printing is cloud-enabled using print queues/cloud printing manager and output control is handled via Output Parameter Determination

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('APOC_WD_BRF_DEC_TAB_MAINTAIN()')/S35

3.1 Maintain rules in Output Parameter Determination

  1. Open Output Parameter Determination
  2. Choose the business document/application relevant to supplier invoices
  3. Maintain rules so that for Channel = PRINT you set Printer Settings and default a Print Queue

If you don’t default a queue you’ll hit the classic error Print queue name cannot be initial. SAP Note says the fix is to maintain OPD rules in step Printer Settings or set the queue manually before triggering output

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3609823

Point 4.

1. Post a supplier invoice

2. Open Print Supplier Invoices

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('MRM_PRINT_WRAPPER')/S35

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/6583f0d4d799462f929b5ba0832211c7.html

3. Monitor:

    • Maintain Print Queues / print queue items
    • Cloud Print Manager logs / queue options

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP - APIM - Demystified: Designing a Single API Proxy with Dynamic Routing for Multiple Tar
entry.content:
@rhviana I just feel more confident for future maintainability to create API Proxy per one Iflow, even if they are very related to others (from the same CI package as you described). For me applying the same policy template (to not copy-paste) is sufficient level of reusability, and of course relying on API provider if possible. Having clear list of API proxies that refer 1:1 to all APIs in backened (whether it is S/4H or CI) is matter of unified approach. But most important is separation of concerns - you can apply easily different policy if needed (+ increment versioning of proxy), undeploy whole proxy/ leave others active, monitor them separately etc. Just simple design.

Of course your presented approach with bundled API makes sense as well. However, it introduces critical question: where do you draw the line? How do you decide which Iflows to group together? Without clear boundaries, you could end up with an extreme scenario: one master API proxy per API provider (CI, S/4HANA, SFSF, third-party systems) with complex conditional routing and policy logic. At that point, you've essentially created a monolithic integration gateway that sacrifices clarity and flexibility for perceived consolidation benefits (minimize number of Proxies)

As usually, no clear answers 🙂

br

Mateusz

entry.title: Unexpected Line Item Extraction Behavior in Purchase Orders using SAP Document AI
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are currently using SAP Document Information Extraction (Premium Edition) and we have created a custom schema based on SAP’s standard Purchase Order schema.

The issue we are facing is related to line item extraction.
When we submit multi-page Purchase Orders, DOX often extracts line items from tables that are NOT the correct PO item table, and in many cases, those tables are located on different pages of the document. These “wrong” tables have a very similar structure to the real item table, which seems to confuse the detection.

What we have tried so far

1️⃣Edited documents in the DOX UI, corrected the fields, confirmed the results and submitted feedback (ground truth).
2️⃣Created a Template, associated the corrected documents to it, and executed extraction again using this template.

However, even after multiple training attempts, DOX still extracts line items from the wrong table/page in many cases.

Constraints

Splitting the PDF is not an option, because the “wrong” table is not always on the same page (for example, it is not always page 2). The page position is not consistent.

My questions

  • Shouldn’t this be resolved by using templates and providing repeated feedback?

  • Is this a limitation of DOX template training?

  • Is there any recommended approach or best practice to handle scenarios where multiple similar tables exist across different pages?

Any guidance, clarification, or alternative approach would be really appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP - APIM - Demystified: Designing a Single API Proxy with Dynamic Routing for Multiple Tar
entry.content:
@MateuszPiotrowski 

I agree that a 1:1 proxy-to-API model is often the safest and clearest default, especially when independent lifecycle, versioning, monitoring, and policies are required


The bundled approach is not meant to replace this model universally, but to address scalability and governance challenges in larger landscapes.

The key is defining clear boundaries: grouping should be based on a stable consumer contract or business capability, not on technical providers, to avoid creating a monolithic gateway.


In practice, both patterns can coexist and should be applied intentionally based on scale, governance needs, and team maturity.

entry.title: Re: Generic IDoc Outbound flow in Cloud Integration Pipeline
entry.content:
@FrantisekV just to confirm in the beginning - the issue is in the backend, not related to ARCKEY handling by Generic IDoc Outbound flow, right? As of now IDoc receiver adapter is not able to construct ARCKEY automatically, it is a backlog item for later implementation, so the ARCKEY to be provided from Step 07 (interface-specific) and Generic IDoc Outbound will pass it to the backend (there is only a validation that if SapPlainSoapQoS is ExactlyOnceInOrder, then ARCKEY is mandatory).

Regarding the backend part - you can check t-code BD103_EOIO what is the next expected sequence counter for your queue.
The components that you are reflected per Note are correct, however, the queue is used in ABAP as uuid_c32, that's why I used in a similar IDoc EOIO inbound interface the following script for components formatting:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import java.security.MessageDigest

def Message processData(Message message) {
def headers = message.getHeaders()
def idoc = headers.get("nextIDoc")
def queueName = headers.get("SapQueueId")
def padded = idoc.toString().padLeft(10, '0')
message.setHeader("nextIDoc", padded)
message.setHeader("SapQueueId", hashQueueName(queueName).toUpperCase())
return message
}

def hashQueueName(String name) {
MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5")
byte[] digest = md.digest(name.bytes)
return digest.encodeHex().toString()
}

And the construct the value in Content Modifier (I did not use ReconciliationIndicator in my case):

urn:sap.com:seq=${header.SapQueueId}-${header.nextIDoc}-${header.Date}-

You can find the type SIDHT in SE11 that is used in ABAP for ARCKEY split (queue name is 32 chars and queue counter is 10 as you mentioned):

TYPES: BEGIN OF sidht_type_eoio_id,
  prefix TYPE c LENGTH 16,
  queue_name TYPE bdeoio_queue_name,
  sep1 TYPE c,
  queue_counter TYPE bdeoio_queue_counter,
  sep2 TYPE c,
  last_idoc TYPE datum,
  sep3 TYPE c,
  recon_flag TYPE flag,
  END OF sidht_type_eoio_id.

Hope this helps.

  END OF sidht_type_eoio_id.

Hope this helps.

entry.title: Re: Generic IDoc Outbound flow in Cloud Integration Pipeline
entry.content:
@FrantisekV just to confirm in the beginning - the issue is in the backend, not related to ARCKEY handling by Generic IDoc Outbound flow, right? As of now IDoc receiver adapter is not able to construct ARCKEY automatically, it is a backlog item for later implementation, so the ARCKEY to be provided from Step 07 (interface-specific) and Generic IDoc Outbound will pass it to the backend (there is only a validation that if SapPlainSoapQoS is ExactlyOnceInOrder, then ARCKEY is mandatory).

Regarding the backend part - you can check t-code BD103_EOIO what is the next expected sequence counter for your queue.
The components that you are reflected per Note are correct, however, the queue is used in ABAP as uuid_c32, that's why I used in a similar IDoc EOIO inbound interface the following script for components formatting:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import java.security.MessageDigest

def Message processData(Message message) {
def headers = message.getHeaders()
def idoc = headers.get("nextIDoc")
def queueName = headers.get("SapQueueId")
def padded = idoc.toString().padLeft(10, '0')
message.setHeader("nextIDoc", padded)
message.setHeader("SapQueueId", hashQueueName(queueName).toUpperCase())
return message
}

def hashQueueName(String name) {
MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5")
byte[] digest = md.digest(name.bytes)
return digest.encodeHex().toString()
}

And the construct the value in Content Modifier (I did not use ReconciliationIndicator in my case):

urn:sap.com:seq=${header.SapQueueId}-${header.nextIDoc}-${header.Date}-

You can find the type SIDHT in SE11 that is used in ABAP for ARCKEY split (queue name is 32 chars and queue counter is 10 as you mentioned):

TYPES: BEGIN OF sidht_type_eoio_id,
  prefix TYPE c LENGTH 16,
  queue_name TYPE bdeoio_queue_name,
  sep1 TYPE c,
  queue_counter TYPE bdeoio_queue_counter,
  sep2 TYPE c,
  last_idoc TYPE datum,
  sep3 TYPE c,
  recon_flag TYPE flag,
  END OF sidht_type_eoio_id.

entry.title: Re: Resetting Total Counter Reading
entry.content:
Hello @mohammed_mehebub ,

Here you go:

1. You can try to change the counter over reading value. Make it equal to current reading or just one unit more than exiting reading.

2. Then enter the new reading. The counter will rest automatically and starts from zero again.

3. Try it in Development or Quality server first.

4. Take approval from client then do it in Production.

Vaibhav Mishra

entry.title: Re: Requirement for OR-based Multiple Maintenance Interva...
entry.content:
Hello @mohit9210 ,

You will require a maintenance plan but different maintenance items with a separate task list for each maint. item. Task list will have one operation such as Engine service. If the condition full fills it will trigger the order. I request you to create this scenario in Dev or Quality server and see the results. 

Actually with cycle set you cannot assign different frequencies (with AND/ OR conditions) at task list operation level. Therefore one single task list won't help.

Vaibhav Mishra

entry.title: 2025 set the pace, 2026 wins the race: ABAP AI with Joule, VS Code, and CCM
entry.content:
Back from a blissful Christmas/New Year reset and sprinting to the keyboard—time to swap hot cocoa for hot commits. 2025 made the promise real: prompts → projects, minutes not weeks, and Joule as ABAP’s turbo button. Now we scale in 2026: agentic flows over widgets, VS Code first‑class, and AI‑driven Custom Code Migration as the headline act. Goodbye 2025, and happy New Year 2026—let’s ship.

What happened in 2025 and what are the peaks of 2026? Stay with me for a full retrospective of ABAP AI in 2025 and sneak preview into 2026:

Build fast (Joule on the keyboard)

  • Real-time help that knows ABAP Cloud: context-aware suggestions, code prediction, and clean-core patterns.
  • Explain anything: ABAP and CDS code explained in plain language—no more reverse-engineering marathons.
  • Tests on tap: Instant unit tests for ABAP and CDS.
  • Roll your own AI: ABAP AI SDK powered by ISLM to plug governed GenAI into ABAP scenarios.

Ship whole apps (from help to “done”)

  • OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard + Joule chat: full RAP apps in minutes—entities, behavior, service binding, OData.
  • RAP Business Logic Prediction: validations and determinations generated in-context, following RAP best practices.
  • OData consumption in seconds: /consume generates tailored client proxy code and examples.
  • Extensibility AI Assistant (Public Cloud): add custom fields, find contexts, enable usage, locate value helps, discover BAdIs—by asking.

Migrate with confidence (legacy to S/4HANA-ready)

  • /docs for migration: chat with SAP Help, simplification items, and cookbooks—answers tied to your scenario.
  • Explain legacy code: purpose, flow, data dependencies—thousands-line “mystery” programs, understood in seconds.
  • Explain ATC findings: root cause, business impact, recommended APIs, and fix examples for S/4 readiness checks.
  • Custom Code Migration AI Assistant (Private 2025): bring all of the above into your S4/HANA simplification with 2025 PCE delivery
  • Next up: the standalone Custom Code Migration Application on BTP ABAP connects to any ERP (on-prem or cloud) for RISE and deliver code adaptation proposals with SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS01.

Availability and how to start

  • Joule for Developers is free for another year: 8019124 (customers), 8019541 (TDD partners). Available for BTP ABAP, S/4HANA Cloud Public, and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (2025). Read more on The AI Revolution Accelerates – Chapter 2 Awaits.
  • Use the ABAP AI SDK to build governed AI scenarios.
  • Adopt the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant (Private 2025) and the BTP-based Custom Code Migration Application for cross-system analysis soon to come
  • Explore SAP Help and Bolg community content from Sonja Lienard and Alexander Rother.

A sneak-peek of 2026

2025 proved ABAP AI. 2026 scales it—fast. The shift: from features to frameworks, from capabilities to flows, from PoCs to enterprise-grade AI across the ABAP stack.

Agentic ABAP AI: workflows, not widgets

  • Agent-led flows own the whole task: understand → transform → test → enforce clean core.
  • ABAP Agentic AI Flow and side-by-side agents become standard; existing use cases migrate into agent models available also for older S/4HANA Private Cloud versions.
  • Aligned with Joule’s agentic direction and interoperable with industry patterns.

Joule everywhere: VS Code goes first class

  • VS Code support: ABAP language server, ABAP MCP server, native Joule for Developers.
  • One feel across Eclipse, VS Code, and future cloud IDEs—AI where devs actually work.
  • Next J4D wave: sharper suggestions, clearer explanations, feedback loops

Flagship 2026: AI-driven Custom Code Migration (CCM)

  • Double down on custom code adaptation proposal, follow up by clean-core recommendations, fit-to-standard analysis, clean core propose transformations, and code explain extension to more ABAP legacy objects
  • Deep agentic integration and customer-ready RISE scenarios—CCM is the hero use case.

Foundations level up: SDK, ABAP LLMs, benchmarking

  • AI SDK adds orchestration, structured outputs, streaming, and broader compatibility.
  • SAP-trained ABAP LLMs become consumable for higher-fidelity code understanding and generation.
  • Benchmarking and telemetry are standardized and automated for accuracy, price, and performance.

ABAP-tuned LLMs: SAP doubles down via AI Core

  • Continue doubling down on ABAP AI models that bake in ABAP/CDS knowledge, SAP semantics, and clean‑core patterns for higher‑fidelity understanding and safer code generation.
  • Delivered through AI Core: enterprise governed access with tenant isolation, metering and cost control, standardized observability and benchmarking and versioned lifecycle management 
  • Plug-and-play integration: native hooks in Joule for Developers and the ABAP AI SDK, plus standardized benchmarking and telemetry as usage scales.

Bottom line for 2026

That’s the play: ship early, scale smart, keep the core clean—agentic flows doing the heavy lifting, Joule first‑class in VS Code, and AI‑driven CCM leading the migration sprint while ABAP‑tuned models via AI Core keep it governed. From prompts to production—minutes, not weeks.  

Happy New Year 2026— If 2025 unlocked ABAP AI’s potential, 2026 will make ABAP AI the core of ABAP development.

entry.title: Re: Split Valuation in SAP MM
entry.content:
Prezado Aluizio,

Primeiramente agradeço sua enorme contribuição com o tema, considerando o mercado brasileiro extremamente relevante para SAP.

Retomamos o tema desde a última postagem e verificamos que a SAP possui uma nota em que poderemos aplicar via customização a habilitação dos campos ao menos para pedido de compra e requisição de compra. Vide abaixo mais detalhes:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2287838

Do ponto de vista da requisição, entendo que não seja relevante habilitar o campo, pois a decisão sobre o material ser de uma determinada origem conforme a legislação brasileira é no ato da emissão do Pedido de Compra.

No entanto, a nota 2287838 não contempla habilitar Contrato e Programa de Remessa (documentos predecessores para a geração de um documento de compra) onde irão refletir as condições negociadas para um Pedido de Compra (originado de um Contrato, inclusive tipo de avaliação, utilização, origem e NCM) e Programa de Remessas para Entregas (originado de um Programa de Remessas, semelhante a um Contrato, inclusive tipo de avaliação, utilização, origem e NCM).

Objetivando o amadurecimento do tema em empresas brasileiras, peço unirmos forças para redesenho destes pontos e abertura de um ticket na SAP.

entry.title: Issue/Improvement request: Chrome password manager overwrites credentials across Career Sites hosted
entry.content:
Hello SAP Support Team,

I would like to report an issue I have consistently experienced when using SAP SuccessFactors Career Sites hosted under the shared domain careerXX.sapsf.com. Please note that this message reflects my personal experience as an end user.

Context
Our company’s career site is hosted under a URL structure similar to:
https://career17.sapsf.com/

I frequently access multiple SuccessFactors career sites that are hosted under the same base domain (e.g. https://career17.sapsf.com/, https://career17.sapsf.com/) using the same email address, but with different passwords per tenant.

Observed behaviour
When I sign in on Google Chrome and Chrome offers to save the password, the credential is saved at the domain level (https://career17.sapsf.com) rather than being differentiated by the tenant path. As a result, Chrome overwrites the previously saved password for the same username/email when I log into a different tenant under the same domain. This effectively prevents me from storing multiple distinct passwords for different tenants hosted on careerXX.sapsf.com.

Impact
This leads to repeated login failures and forces frequent “forgot password” resets when switching between different career portals, which is time-consuming and creates unnecessary friction.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Log into https://career17.sapsf.com/ using email and password A; allow Chrome to save the password.

  2. Log into https://career17.sapsf.com/ using the same email and password B; allow Chrome to save/update the password.

  3. Return to : Chrome will offer/auto-fill the credentials saved for the domain (often password B), resulting in failed authentication unless the password is reset or manually entered.

Environment

  • Browser: Google Chrome (latest stable at time of testing)

  • OS: Windows 11

  • Authentication: username/email + password

  • Hosting pattern: shared domain careerXX.sapsf.com with tenant differentiation by URL path

Request
Could you please confirm whether this is expected browser behaviour given the shared-domain, path-based tenant structure? If so, I would appreciate SAP’s recommended best practice to mitigate the issue (e.g. use of a customer-specific domain/CNAME, alternative URL strategy, or authentication approach) to avoid credential collisions in password managers.

I am happy to provide screenshots or a short screen recording if needed.

Kind regards,
Christian Jerez

entry.title: Re: Disable standard field in ME22N,ME21N
entry.content:
Prezados,

Estamos passando por uma situação similar na Localização Brasil.

Ativamos o split valuation para inúmeros cadastros de materiais.

Ocorre que no Brasil há legislação bem complexa, onde por exemplo o código de origem de material (baseado a partir da CST no XML da NF-e) fica "bloqueado" para edição pelo emissor do Pedido de Compra, Contrato ou Programa de Remessa quando o split valuation é ativado.

Esse tipo de bloqueio deste campo pode gerar:

- retrabalho pelo comprador, antes de emitir o documento de compra, solicitando ao time de Master Data para alterar a origem do material antes de emitir Pedido de Compra, Contrato ou Programa de Remessa;

- caso o comprador opte por emitir o documento de compra sem acionar o Master Data, o BP (Fornecedor) irá receber o PO e realizar o faturamento, mas poderá haver divergência entre PO x NF-e, portanto, nesse momento a Fatura ficará aguardando solicitação do Comprador (Suprimentos) para alterar no cadastro (Master Data), após a alteração o Comprador (Suprimentos) elimina a linha do PO e reinsere com os dados "alterados" e reaprova o Pedido de Compra, e por último a fatura é implantada no SAP;

- podemos até pensar em criar split para a quantidade de origens da localização Brasil, mas ficaria impraticável o gerenciamento, ou seja, um único material ter de 1 até 9 split valuations em função das quantidades de origens de cada material variar. Nesse sentido, o Requisitante de Compra poderá selecionar um split valuation com Origem "0" por exemplo, mas é o Comprador que após consultar diversificados Fornecedores no mercado que definirá a melhor opção de compra, portanto, irá gerar retrabalho na Requisição de Compra com a troca do split valuation.

- avançando para o campo "Utilização" que também fica bloqueado com a ativação do split valuation, poderemos comprar o mesmo material para "consumo" ou para "imobilizado", portanto, seguindo a mesma lógica supracitada.

Nesse sentido, identificamos a SAP 2287838, onde detalha ser possível habilitar via customização os campos para Pedido de Compra e Requisição de Compra, mas não menciona a possibilidade de habilitar para Contrato e Programa de Remessa.

Note https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2287838

Nesse sentido, seria extremamente importante a SAP identificar oportunidades de melhoria standard para garantir que a legislação do Brasil seja convergida com o SAP/4Hana e utilizarmos a função com segurança e garantia técnica de funcionamento.

entry.title: EWM QM Serial Number Integration on S4 HANA 2025 FPS00
entry.content:
New Functionality from S4 HANA 2025 FPS00- This New feature enables to record a quality inspection result for a specific serialized product in the Quality Management (QM) component of SAP S/4HANA by recording a usage decision for the serialized product with reference to its serial number. The system copies the serial number to the inspection lot in the QM component during the goods receipt posting of the stock item.

Main Features of QM EWM Serial number Integration.

  • Valid for both Embedded and Decentral systems.
  •  Used in IOT4 and IOT5 scenarios (both Ad-Hoc and Recurring) as well as in Synchronous Posting.
  • Summary Level Inspection can happen prior to UD( Technically at time of Result recording)
  • During results recording,  Inspection results for single products with reference to their corresponding serial numbers can be recorded( Summary Level).
  • Summary level can only be invoked for Inbound delivery posting and hence not possible for Synchronous Posting.

How to Set up-

Activate serial Number integration in IOT 4 or 5 customizing( The summary level QM EWM is implicitly explained in F4)

 

Configure Serial Number Profile

Use the Procedure QMSL( Usage must be 3)

 

Master Data MM03

Activate Inspection Type 01( Embedded EWM) & 1701 in Case of Decentralized EWM on S4 with below indicator( Serial Numbers Possible for Inspection Lot)

SAP implicitly mentioning 3 things here

  1. 'Inspection Lot Summary' can be conducted even with Serial no activation 
  2. Serial number can be copied to Pre-sampling in Production scenarios
  3. Serial number is copied during GR posting( IOT 4 & IOT 5), Inbound delivery based as well Synchronous posting based.

Testing performed using MIGO( Synchronous Based)

Serial numbers are assigned to Inspection Lot QA03

Serial numbers are available at time of Result Recording QE01/QE51N( Screen shot of GR posted of 3 EA of different serial numbers than above)

 

Serial number are available at time of Usage decision( This functionality was already available from S4H 1709 onwards & 9.5)

This functionality of QM EWM Serial number integration is now exactly same like IM Based QM integration which earlier was missing.

Thanks for reading. All tests are performed in S4 HANA 2025 FPS00 Sandbox system 

References:

Help. SAP Serial Numbers in Inspection Results | SAP Help Portal

SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA ... - SAP Community

entry.title: How to enhance the ATTP on S/4HANA Fiori Apps with customized fields
entry.content:
This blog explains how to enhance the standard delivered Fiori Apps from SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals on S/4HANA by adding a appended field into the List Report and Object Page.

 

Target of the enhancement:

For an appended field (Z_CUSTOMFIELD1) in the event table (/STTP/DM_EVT):

  • Add it to the Display Events Fiori App as a Global Filter and a List Report column

  • Display it on the Object Page as well

 

Pre-requisites:

To do the same in your system, the developer is expected to have the following background:

  • Medium-level understanding of ATTP repository table structures and relationships
  • Basic ABAP Data Dictionary enhancement knowledge (appended structure, appended fields, etc.)
  • Basic to medium-level CDS View knowledge (CDS basics, VDM, view extension, etc.)
  • Medium-level Fiori annotation knowledge (List Report and Object Page annotations, metadata extension, etc.)
  • ADT (ABAP Development Tools), as most developments will be conducted there

And the enhancement will be entirely based on ABAP & CDS View & Annotations, no frontend development involved.

 

Solution in general:

For the Fiori Apps delivered in ATTP S4, their backend services were built with RAP Framework (ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model). With this framework, the OData services for the Fiori Apps are built with CDS Views providing data, and the UI annotations providing UI layouts (this is a highly abstracted summary 😀).

So, to enhance the Fiori Apps as we wanted, basically we need to do 2 things:

  1. Enhance the CDS views to include the appended field in the OData Service
  2. Enhance the Fiori UI Annotations to render the appended field onto the designated places in UI

 

Solution in detail:

Step 1: Enhance the CDS views to include Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 from table /STTP/DM_EVT

First, identify the related CDS views for the Display Events Fiori app. You can use the following steps:

In ADT, open the package /STTP/WEBUI. This is where the OData services for all ATTP S4 Fiori apps are located.

From the package description we can tell:

  • /STTP/EVENT_DATA_CDS contains the CDS views for the Display Events app
  • /STTP/EVENT_ODATA_SRV contains the OData service definitions

Though we are trying to find the correct CDS views to work on the enhancement, but as they are often layered and numerous, a good way is to start from the OData service definitions:

  • Open the service definitions in package /STTP/EVENT_ODATA_SRV and see which CDS views are exposed.

below are the CDS views:

  • Because the appended field is in the event table, the consumption view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT is the right candidate to enhance.
  • Ctrl+click /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT to navigate to it. You will see it projects from /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT_E:

which in turn is based on /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT

of which the base table is /STTP/DM_EVT (the event table - where the appended field was added):

 

Now we take a break and summarize the realted artifacts:

  • CDS view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT (consumption view, used directly by the OData service)
  • CDS view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT_E
  • CDS view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT (interface/base view reading from the DB table)
  • DB table /STTP/DM_EVT (the table where the appended field is added)

Because the appended field is currently only in /STTP/DM_EVT, we need to have it in all related CDS views, bottom-up:

For CDS view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT:

  • Create a View Entity Extension (new Data Definition using the extendViewEntity template)

Enter Package, Name and Description:

In the next steps, ensure you are selecting the extendViewEntity as template

  • Add the appended field Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 to the extended view and activate it

Then do the same for the view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT_E:

  • Create a similar View Entity Extension
  • Add Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 to the extended view

Also, for consumption view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT:

  • Create a View Entity Extension
  • Add Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 to the extended view

Afterwards - for verification only - run the view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT as ABAP Application to ensure the extended field is in the result columns:

At this point, Step 1 is complete: Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 is included in the CDS views and thus in the OData service.

Step 2: Make the appended field appear in the Fiori UI via annotations

Next, we will bring the field into the List Report and Object Page.

List Report:

One good news is - Since the consumption view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT has been enhanced with the custom field, it is automatically propagated to the OData service and to the Display Events Fiori app. In the List Report, the field will be available in the global filters and as a table column (typically hidden by default).

And if you enable the filter, and use it to search with related value, it will work too:

To provide default visibility, you can add below annotation in the extension view for /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT (which you created in the previous step):

(Use the position value to control ordering among other filters and fields.)

And the result looks like the following:

 

Object Page:

Here, we need to firstly understand how existing fields are added to the Object Page. The simple answer is – via Annotations from the Metadata Extension File for /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT. If you open that metadata extension file (search in your ADT with name /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT, select the one with file type Metadata Extension), you will find the Facet definition which is cater for the definition of Event Field Group in the Details section, and that’s where we wanted to place our custom field:

To add the custom field there:

  • Note down the “targetQualifier” of the target facet to be enhanced – “eventInfo”,
  • Add below annotation to the extension view:

Again, use the position attribute to control where the field appears relative to other fields.

Then the Custom Field is enhanced successfully in the Object Page too, and this concludes the development.

 

Recap:

The major development work was placed at the Extension View of /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT, and this is how it looks like after the development:

  • The extended field provides the data access of the appended field to the Fiori App.
  • The annotations provides how we want to display the appended field in standard Fiori App:
    • The annotation @ui.selectionField: [xxxx] enables the appened field into the global filer
    • The annotation @ui: { lineItem: [xxxx]} enables the appended field into the list table
    • The annotation @ui.fieldGroup: [xxxx] enables the appended field into the Object Page

Thanks for reading. I hope you find this blog helpful, and pls remember that there are many more Fiori annotations that you can apply and use in your project to shape the enhanced fields per your needs, like adding value helps, define text descriptions etc.

You can check the Fiori Element and UI Annotations documentations and find more. Cheers.

(END)

entry.title: 浏览迁移对象App——你也能成为数据迁移专家
entry.content:
除了迁移范围，还有迁移顺序

在Cloud ERP里，数据迁移是每个客户、每个项目都会用到的部分。从最早的十几个迁移对象，到现在超过200个迁移对象。我们除了需要定义迁移范围（需要用到哪些迁移对象，因为不可能每个迁移对象都会用到），另外一个非常重要的是需要知道迁移顺序。也就是你所有准备导入的迁移对象里，哪一个先导入，哪一个后导入。在每一次做数据迁移的时候，都需要规划好迁移顺序。虽然在SAP Help Portal的迁移对象页面上，能查到每个迁移对象的前序依赖对象，比如销售订单，你能看到以下迁移对象是它的前序对象，其中客户和产品这两个迁移对象是必须的，其他为可选的。但是文字的方式总不是特别方便。很多客户提出过希望有一个可以图形化查看迁移对象依赖关系的地方……

 

 

千呼万唤始出来

终于，从2508.3版本开始，我们推出了数据迁移下面一个全新的应用“浏览迁移对象”，能够让我们可以图形化的方式来展示迁移对象之间的依赖关系，可以显示迁移对象的必须或可选的前序对象。

这个应用的权限信息如下：

业务目录：SAP_CA_BC_MIG_PC

默认的业务角色：SAP_BR_CONFIG_EXPERT_DATA_MIG

 

 

深入浅出“浏览迁移对象”

当你打开应用“浏览迁移对象”，你会看到下面这样一个界面。可以有两种方式来显示迁移对象的依赖关系：

  1. 在所有当前可用的迁移对象里，选择某个迁移对象，来显示它的前序对象。
  2. 因为我们的功能是按照范围项目（Scope item）来划分的，有时候我们想知道某个范围项目牵涉到哪些迁移对象。所以你也可以选择某个范围项目，来显示跟这个范围项目相关的迁移对象。

 

 

根据迁移对象查看

比如，选择迁移对象“客户 - 按新组织级别扩展现有记录”（CUST_EXT_3），你会看到以下这个界面：

 

你选择的迁移对象会显示在最左边，它的前序依赖对象在它的右边。

你能看到有两种不同的线，橙色的实线代表这个前序对象是必须的，也就是如果你要导入“客户 - 按新组织级别扩展现有记录”，你必须先导入“客户”这个迁移对象。灰色的虚线代表是可选的前序对象。在这个例子里，“FI-CA 合同合作伙伴”、“银行”和“供应商”是3个可选的前序迁移对象。

 

在上方，你能看到一条菜单栏如下：

 

点击Transpose按钮，你可以把图形在横向展示和竖向展示之间切换。不同的情况可能不同的展示方式更为方便，或者方便你截图：

 

 

菜单上也可以点击显示图例：

 

以及缩放和全屏显示的按钮。

 

当然，这个应用绝不是这些功能这么简单！

如果你点击某个节点，在这个节点的右方，会出现几个节点按钮：

 

你可以选择折叠或展开与该节点相关的其他节点，也可以快速跳转到这个迁移对象的详细文档页面。你也可以点击某个节点，来展示与它相关的前序迁移对象。

 

根据范围项目来查看

你也可以根据范围项目来查看与它相关的迁移对象。例如，你选择BLF（批次管理），你会得到以下这个界面：

 

这就展示了如果需要使用BLF批次管理，那么这些迁移对象需要考虑做导入。这个功能也方便了我们的功能顾问来规划迁移范围，不会遗漏应该需要导入的数据。

同样的，我也可以点击上面的任何节点，来展示它是否还有前序对象。比如我选择“类”这个对象，显示依赖关系，我会得到以下的界面：

 

你可以看到，类这个迁移对象，它有两个可选的前序对象。

 

未来功能的展望

对于这个新应用，还是会有一些新的功能点在未来会被支持。比如，不是显示所有的迁移对象，而是显示在这个系统中被激活的迁移对象可能会更合适。

另外，显示迁移对象的类型，主数据或者交易数据，这也会是一个经常会用到的过滤点。也有计划会展示迁移对象是否支持关键用户扩展。

 

如果你想要了解更详细的关于浏览迁移对象（Explore Migration Objects）的介绍，你也可以看一下我们的数据迁移专家Frank Finkbohner的博文：The New Explore Migration Objects App, The Game Ch... - SAP Community

 

最后，希望你会喜欢这个数据迁移的新应用。如果你有任何问题，欢迎留言！

entry.title: Utilizing Employee Central Quick Actions to support Internal hires with Onboarding
entry.content:
In this article we will discuss a specific requirement from a customer for their internal moves within the same legal entity and whether onboarding is needed to deliver the desired business results.

In this specific scenario an employee moves within the same legal entity.  The customer would like the employee to check that their home address is accurate, they do not need to sign any new forms, nor do they need any onboarding tasks completed.  The customer thought they should configure the following.

  1. Onboarding for internal hires is initiated from SuccessFactors Recruitment.
  2. The SuccessFactors Employee Central record is updated based on the data from SuccessFactors Recruitment. 
  3. The system will trigger an 'Onboarding process' for the employee to check their data via 'Personal Data Collection'.

This is a perfectly valid process, but as the customer only wants to check the address, is this the best option?  A potential downside of this process is that unless the employee completes the process the onboarding task will remain open on the onboarding dashboard, and it is a rather complex solution to a basic requirement.  An alternative is as follows. When the SuccessFactors Employee Central record is updated, Employee Central sends an employee a custom email or alert that could say something like this.

Dear employee

As you now have a new position in the organisation, we would like you to double check that your home address is still correct.  The first line of your address in the system is ‘XXXX’, if this is still correct then you do not need to do anything else.

If the address is incorrect then please log into the system and click on the ‘Manage My Data’ icon and click on ‘Change Address’

Many Thanks

This is what it looks like in SuccessFactors Employee Central

 

This process utilizes the 'quick action cards' and means that we are not using onboarding for this process.  All workflow and permissions are respected when they make an update.

If the requirement also needed some onboarding tasks, you could still trigger this process and have onboarding tasks created via onboarding.  However, if you want the employee to sign documents then you would clearly utilize a full onboarding process.

Hopefully this article provides an insight into the potential flexibility of SuccessFactors Onboarding & Employee Central for certain internal hires scenarios.

entry.title: Is it possible to limit to special files in RAG
entry.content:
Hi,Expert, 

We can integrate Object store or SharePoint Site into AI Core , then we can use RAG . If there end user raise a query to AI Core.  Then AI Core can answer the query based files in object tore and SharePoint . But we need AI Core answer the query based on specified files . Is this technical requirements possible ?

You may ask why ?  For example,  customer need to develop a solution to evaluate the projects Auction/BID intelligently . Every project have requirements in files in PDF WORD, EXCEL. Every vendor will  submit fills in PDF WORD EXCEL as a BID . Then AI Core need evaluate  based on specific project's files and BIDs' files from vendor.

You may suggest to use HANA vector , then the question is why customer need to store the files multiple times which will increase cost .  And the since the files are in different types.  Can one splitter can cove all these files types ? The situation become more complicated .

Your suggestions and discussions are welcomed!

Best Regards!

Jacky Liu

entry.title: Successfactors - Custom MDF - Unique Identifier
entry.content:
Hi All,

We require a system-generated unique identifier for each record created in a custom MDF object related to Travel. This identifier must be assigned only at the time of record creation and must remain unchanged during subsequent edits or workflow updates. We explored multiple approaches but encountered the following limitations:

  1. A Save Rule was implemented at the object level, using a custom field to store the identifier. However, this resulted in the identifier being regenerated on every record edit or upon workflow completion.

  2. UI Rules were evaluated, but they do not support the generation of sequential or system-controlled unique identifiers.

  3. The externalCode field was configured as a String to manually control the identifier; however, this prevented the object from being associated with the Latest People Profile.

Seeking expert advise to handle this scenario.

Thanks in advance.
